question_text: Select two reasons why a tethered device might be unable to access the internet even though it's connected to the phone.
answer_options: Mobile data is disabled on the phone
The tethered device has an outdated OS
The phone has no carrier signal
correct_answer: Mobile data is disabled on the phone
The phone has no carrier signal
explanation: Tethering relies on the host phone’s mobile data connection. If data is off or there’s no signal, the internet will not be reachable.
